Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Emericellipsin E (EmiE , Lipopeptaibol, natural AMPs, nonribosomal peptide, fungii; XXL, XXM, XXK)

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: the amino acid sequence has been extensively modified. Structure is Methyldecanoyl-MePro-AHMOD-Ala-Aib-Ile-Iva-bAla-Aib-Glyol (see below).Chemical modification: P1 is methylated, residue 2 is represented by Q but it is 2-Amino-4-methyl-6-hydroxy-8-oxo decanoic acid (AHMOD), residues 4 and 6 are isovaline, residue 7 is beta-alanine, residue 8 is aminoisobutiric acid, and residue 9 is ethanolamine.Activity: Disc diffusion assay: activity was not detected. Microdilution assays: A. niger ATCC 16404 (MIC >64 ug/ml), A. niger 1133 m (MIC >64 ug/ml), A. terreus 3 K (MIC 32 ug/ml), A. terreus 497 (MIC 64 ug/ml), A. fumigatus VKM F-37 (MIC >64 ug/ml), and A. fumigatus 390 m (MIC >64 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Kuvarina AE, Gavryushina IA, Kulko AB, Ivanov IA, Rogozhin EA, Georgieva ML, Sadykova VS.2021
Literature Information.Title: The Emericellipsins A-E from an Alkalophilic Fungus Emericellopsis alkalina Show Potent Activity against Multidrug-Resistant Pathogenic Fungi.
